titleStmt.title: G. W. Williams to Thomas E. BRamlette
CWG6905

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Enclosed you will find the petition of Delaney Sanders for the remission of a fine of $120 imposed on him for seting his fence in the road -- Your will observe that the petition is signed by all the Jurors and the Judge who tried the indictment, which is the best evidence that we can furnish to Your Excellency of the merits of his application -- I as his attorney can only add, that I think, public Justice Does not require the enforcement of the Judgment
Trusting your Excellency may find it Covenient with Your sense of duty to remit the fine I have the honor

to be Yours &c
G. W. Williams

To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Govr of Ky &c

Thos E Bramlette Govr of Ky &c
Frankfort
Ky
